main event: A definite contrail with a phosphorescent glow and intermittent flashes was sighted at Ladd Field in Alaska on 9 January 1948.
interesting points: The sighting was made by five officers and men of the 72nd Reconnaissance Squadron.
The object or aircraft was initially vertical on the horizon and then appeared to be horizontal as it came closer.
The contrail was lost in the overcast just east of Ladd Field.
After thorough investigation, it was concluded that the contrail was caused by a B-29 aircraft practicing instrument approaches on the Ladd Field range.
The report mentioned positive instructions issued to prevent similar incidents due to inadequate investigation prior to submission of reports.
sighted object: definite contrail with a phosphorescent glow and intermittent flashes
witnesses: five officers and men of the 72nd Reconnaissance Squadron
